overall_description: A classic half-eternity style ring featuring seven round-cut green gemstones (emeralds) set in a shared-prong 18k yellow gold mounting. The design features an open gallery for light optimization and a polished D-profile shank.

image_generation_prompt.main_prompt: A photorealistic 3D render of an empty ring mounting casting, isolated on a neutral background. The object is made of polished 18k yellow gold. It features a curved bridge across the top with seven circular empty seats (recesses) prepared to receive round gemstones. Between each seat are vertical, un-tipped gold prongs standing upright, ready for setting. The under-gallery (side view of the setting) shows open u-shaped latticework detailing. The shank is a smooth, tapered band with a semi-circular cross-section. High metallic reflectivity, smooth surface topology, no gemstones present.
image_generation_prompt.style_modifiers: Macro product photography, sharp focus, 4k texture, studio environment, neutral gray background, 3D asset view
image_generation_prompt.negative_prompt: gemstones, diamonds, green stones, rough surface, noise, blurred, scratches
image_generation_prompt.camera_angle: Perspective view (isometric-like) showing both the top seats and the side profile
image_generation_prompt.lighting_description: Softbox studio lighting to create distinct specular highlights on the gold curvature

components.shape_description: Toroidal base with a linear, slightly curved arcade of settings on the superior aspect.
components.manufacturing_notes: Produced via lost-wax casting. Requires raw casting cleanup, sprue removal, and pre-polishing before stone setting. Prongs must be cast strictly vertical.

image_generation_prompt.main_prompt: A single, isolated round brilliant cut green emerald gemstone. The stone features a flat top table, crown facets, a thin girdle, and a pointed pavilion. The material is transparent, deep vivid green crystal with internal light refraction and slight natural inclusions characteristic of emeralds. The facets are sharp and geometric. The object is floating in space to allow for full 3D reconstruction of the pavilion.
image_generation_prompt.style_modifiers: Gemological photography, caustics, ray-traced refraction, pure white background, high contrast
image_generation_prompt.negative_prompt: metal, ring, jewelry, opaque, plastic, blue, red
image_generation_prompt.camera_angle: Side profile view titled 15 degrees to show table and depth
image_generation_prompt.lighting_description: Backlit and top-lit to emphasize transparency and facet structure

components.material_suggestion: Natural Emerald or Hydrothermal Synthetic Emerald
components.shape_description: Round Brilliant Cut (Cone shape with faceted top)
components.position: Mounted inside the 7 seats of component 1
components.manufacturing_notes: Precision cut required. 7 units required for assembly. Standard diameter (approx 3.0mm - 3.5mm).

additional_notes: The primary manufacturing challenge is the casting of the shared prongs in Component 1; they must be thick enough to secure two stones simultaneously but thin enough to not obscure the gems. Stones are set by bending the metal prongs over the girdle of the stones.
